headline.main: Egyptian Novelist Jailed on Obscenity Charges to Be Released
headline.print_headline: Jailed Egyptian Novelist to Be Released

docs.snippet: An Egyptian court suspended the prison sentence of the writer, Ahmed Naji, in a decision that paves the way for his release....

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Cairo.

docs.lead_paragraph: An Egyptian court suspended the prison sentence of the writer, Ahmed Naji, in a decision that paves the way for his release.

headline.main: Air Berlin Appoints New CEO Following Restructuring
headline.print_headline: Air Berlin Appoints New CEO Following Restructuring

docs.snippet: German airline Air Berlin's chief executive is to step  down in the new year, to be replaced by a senior manager at Lufthansa following a wide-ranging shake-up of the loss-making carrier....
docs.lead_paragraph: German airline Air Berlin's chief executive is to step  down in the new year, to be replaced by a senior manager at Lufthansa following a wide-ranging shake-up of the loss-making carrier.

headline.main: Insurance Policies on Slaves: New York Life’s Complicated Past
headline.print_headline: Reckoning With a Legacy of Insuring Slaves’ Lives

docs.snippet: In its 19th-century beginnings, New York Life Insurance sold 508 policies covering slaves. Their descendants are grappling with it....
docs.abstract: New York Life, nation's third-largest insurance company, began insuring lives of Southerners' slaves in 1846, with insurance policies on slaves accounting for third of company's polices by 1847; legacy underscores ties that contemporary institutions, even those in North, have to painful period in nation's history.

byline.contributor: Kitty Bennett and Doris Burke contributed research.

docs.lead_paragraph: In its 19th-century beginnings, New York Life Insurance sold 508 policies covering slaves. Their descendants are grappling with it.

headline.main: Some Foreign Tourists Rescued From Jordanian Castle Siege, Others Still Held
headline.print_headline: Some Foreign Tourists Rescued From Jordanian Castle Siege, Others Still Held

docs.snippet: At least 10 people, including foreign tourists, were rescued from a besieged medieval fortress in Jordan on Sunday, but others were still being held by the gunmen who took refuge there after a shooting spree on police, two security source said....
docs.lead_paragraph: At least 10 people, including foreign tourists, were rescued from a besieged medieval fortress in Jordan on Sunday, but others were still being held by the gunmen who took refuge there after a shooting spree on police, two security source said.

headline.main: Bipartisan Letter Seeks Single Inquiry Into Russian Hacking Claims

docs.snippet: Senators from both parties urged the creation of a new committee on cyberattacks to investigate possible Russian interference in the American election....

headline.main: Egyptian Court Suspends Author's Jail Sentence Over Sexually Explicit Book: Lawyer
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Court Suspends Author's Jail Sentence Over Sexually Explicit Book: Lawyer

docs.snippet: Egypt's highest court on Sunday ordered the freeing of an author who was jailed for public indecency when extracts from his sexually explicit novel were published in a literary newspaper, his lawyer said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Egypt's highest court on Sunday ordered the freeing of an author who was jailed for public indecency when extracts from his sexually explicit novel were published in a literary newspaper, his lawyer said.

headline.main: Ivory Coast Votes for Parliament, President Seeks Majority
headline.print_headline: Ivory Coast Votes for Parliament, President Seeks Majority

headline.main: Canadian Killed in Shootout at Jordanian Castle, Other Tourists Believed to Be Trapped
headline.print_headline: Canadian Killed in Shootout at Jordanian Castle, Other Tourists Believed to Be Trapped

docs.snippet: A Canadian woman was killed in a shootout between police and armed men who had holed themselves up in a medieval castle in southern Jordan on Sunday, and other tourists were believed to be trapped inside, police and security sources said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Canadian woman was killed in a shootout between police and armed men who had holed themselves up in a medieval castle in southern Jordan on Sunday, and other tourists were believed to be trapped inside, police and security sources said.
